meanings.definition: To speak suddenly and without thinking.
meanings.sent1: During the test, Sarah kept blurting out answers without considering them first.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help blurting out the surprise party plans to his sister.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was blurting random words at the visitors, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a volcano, blurting out words in a fiery eruption.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was blurting out questions faster than anyone could answer.

meanings.sent1: Without warning, he started blurting out his deepest secrets to his friend.
meanings.sent2: She regretted blurting out the news before confirming it with her boss.
meanings.sent3: The magician was blurting out spells left and right, creating chaos.
meanings.sent4: The broken dam was blurting water uncontrollably, flooding the valley.
meanings.sent5: The comedian was blurting jokes so fast that the audience couldn't stop laughing.
